meanings.definition: The act or practice of witchcraft.
meanings.sent1: During the witchings, she brewed potions and cast spells.
meanings.sent2: The village was filled with rumors of witchings happening in the forest.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, her witchings were so convincing that everyone believed she had real magic powers.
meanings.sent4: The witchings of the old tales seemed to come alive in the dark woods.
meanings.sent5: The witchings in the ancient book were both fascinating and terrifying.

meanings.definition: The supernatural power or ability of a witch.
meanings.sent1: Her witchings allowed her to see into the future and communicate with spirits.
meanings.sent2: The witch's witchings were feared and respected by all in the village.
meanings.sent3: The cat's mysterious behavior almost made it seem like it had witchings of its own.
meanings.sent4: The witchings of the coven were said to be so strong, they could control the elements.
meanings.sent5: The witchings of the sorceress were so potent that even the bravest knights trembled in fear.

meanings.definition: The time or period associated with witches or witchcraft.
meanings.sent1: The witchings of Halloween brought out all the spooky decorations in town.
meanings.sent2: Children dressed up as witches and wizards during the witchings of October.
meanings.sent3: The witchings of the past were filled with mystery and superstition.
meanings.sent4: In the witchings of the full moon, strange things were said to happen in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The witchings of the Salem trials are a dark chapter in history.
